main.introduction:
XP is a modular framework consisting of a number of useful classes, making it easier to complete everyday tasks.
The classes are written to serve your needs in any situation:
Command-line tools and cronjobs
GUI applications with the power of GTK-PHP
Web sites using HTML or XML/XSL
SOAP clients/servers
XP brings you nearer to the future of PHP: All of the framework will be migrated to PHP5 and the Zend Engine 2 as soon as these are available and stable.
Learn more...

link.caption: Strong Typing vs. Strong Testing
link.description:
Bruce Eckel, Author of "Thinking in Java", on static vs. dynamic typing. Altough he is using Python in his article, the arguments made could be adapted to PHP, too.
This became a puzzle to me: if strong static type checking is so important, why are people able to build big, complex Python programs (with much shorter time and effort than the strong static counterparts) without the disaster that I was so sure would ensue?

link.caption: Are Dynamic Languages Going to Replace Static Languages?
link.description:
For many years we've been using statically typed languages for the safety they offer. But now, as we all gradually adopt Test Driven Development, are we going to find that safety redundant? Will we therefore decide that the flexibility of dynamically typed languages is desirable?
By Robert C. Martin
